All about Uganda 'Dinga Dinga' fever outbreak which makes patients 'shake like dancing' - CNBCTV18
summary:
All about Uganda 'Dinga Dinga' fever outbreak which makes patients 'shake like dancing'

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

In Uganda's Bundibugyo district, health authorities are investigating a mysterious disease known locally as 'Dinga Dinga,' which manifests as severe body shaking and fever. This outbreak predominantly affects women and girls, with more than 300 reported cases.

  • More than 300 cases of 'Dinga Dinga' fever have been reported, mainly among women and girls.
  • The disease is characterized by fever and uncontrollable body shaking that restricts movement.
  • Health officials are treating patients with antibiotics, although a confirmed diagnosis is still pending.
  • Symptoms include fever, headache, cough, runny nose, and body aches.
  • Health experts are investigating possible links to respiratory pathogens like influenza and COVID-19.
“It was very disturbing. I was taken to the Bundibugyo Hospital for treatment, and thank God, I am now fine.” - Affected Patient

The situation is under close observation as local health authorities urge residents to avoid relying on unverified herbal treatments and instead seek proper medical care.
newTitle: Understanding the 'Dinga Dinga' Fever Outbreak in Uganda

title: European markets slide; Novo Nordisk down 20% after obesity drug results - CNBC
summary:
European Markets Decline Amid U.S. Political Turmoil; Novo Nordisk Shares Drop 20%

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: CNBC

The European markets faced a decline on Friday as investors reacted to recent political instability in the U.S. and monetary policy updates from major economies. Notably, Novo Nordisk experienced a significant stock drop after disappointing trial results for its obesity drug.

Key Points

  • The Stoxx 600 index fell by 1.7% by early afternoon, with all major sectors in the red.
  • Political uncertainty in the U.S. arose from a failed spending bill that could lead to a government shutdown.
  • Novo Nordisk's stock dropped over 20% following disappointing trial results for CagriSema.
  • Volkswagen shares gained more than 2% amid positive negotiation news with striking workers.
  • China held interest rates steady, while the U.S. Fed cut its core interest rate by 25 basis points.
“The pan-European Stoxx 600 index was 1.7% lower by 1:46 p.m. London time, with every sector and all major bourses in negative territory.”

Despite the difficulties in the markets, there are sectors like Volkswagen showing resilience. The overall sentiment remains cautious as investors navigate through the uncertainties.
newTitle: European Markets Decline Amid U.S. Political Turmoil; Novo Nordisk Shares Drop 20%

title: RBI fines IndusInd Bank for ₹27 lakh over non-compliance | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
RBI Fines IndusInd Bank ₹27 Lakh for Non-Compliance

Publication Date: November 20, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹27 lakh on IndusInd Bank Ltd. for failing to comply with regulatory norms by opening savings accounts for ineligible entities.

  • The monetary penalty amounts to ₹27.30 lakh.
  • The RBI's inspection revealed non-compliance with the 'Reserve Bank of India (Interest Rate on Deposits) Directions, 2016.'
  • The inspection assessed the bank's financial position as of March 31, 2023.
  • The penalty does not affect the validity of any transactions made by the bank with its customers.
  • IndusInd Bank reported a 39.5% YoY decline in consolidated net profit for the July-September quarter.
“RBI found, inter alia, that the charge pertaining to opening of certain savings deposit accounts in the name of ineligible entities was sustained, warranting imposition of monetary penalty,” the statement said.

This fine underscores the importance of regulatory compliance in the banking sector and aims to ensure that banks operate within prescribed guidelines to protect consumers and maintain a robust financial system.
newTitle: RBI Fines IndusInd Bank ₹27 Lakh for Non-Compliance

INLD patriarch O P Chautala’s long journey: Five-time CM to 10-year jail and party’s fall - The Indian Express
summary:
O P Chautala: The Rise and Fall of a Political Patriarch

Publication Date: Friday
Source: Indian Express

Om Prakash Chautala, former Chief Minister of Haryana and INLD patriarch, passed away at the age of 89. His political journey spanned over five decades, marked by significant ups and downs, including a conviction and imprisonment.

  • Chautala served as Haryana's CM five times.
  • He was part of a prominent political family; his father was a Deputy Prime Minister.
  • First took office as CM in December 1989 but resigned amidst controversy.
  • Convicted in a recruitment scandal in 2013, serving 10 years in prison.
  • Post-release, his party, INLD, struggled politically, leading to a split with the formation of JJP.
  • INLD’s influence declined significantly, securing only 2 seats in the 2024 Assembly polls.
"He was a dominant figure in Haryana politics for over five decades."

The life of O P Chautala reflects both the rise of a powerful political legacy and the challenges faced by his party in recent years.
newTitle: O P Chautala: The Rise and Fall of a Political Patriarch

title: Archaeological Survey of India surveys newly found temple, wells in Sambhal - Hindustan Times
summary:
Survey of Newly Discovered Ancient Temple and Wells in Sambhal by ASI

Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Officials from the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) conducted a survey of a newly uncovered ancient temple and nearby wells in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, during an anti-encroachment drive.

  • A four-member ASI team inspected a newly found temple, five 'teerth', and 19 wells.
  • The survey lasted 8-10 hours, covering approximately 24 areas.
  • The Shri Kartik Mahadev Temple, also known as Bhasma Shankar temple, was reopened for prayers on December 13 after being closed for decades due to communal riots.
  • The ASI is expected to submit a report on their findings, including requests for carbon dating.
  • This discovery follows recent tensions and violence in the area over related religious surveys.
"The new temple that was found was also inspected. The survey took place 8-10 hours." - Dr. Rajender Pensiya, District Magistrate

This archaeological survey highlights the relevance of historical religious sites amidst ongoing local tensions and the significance of their preservation.
newTitle: Survey of Newly Discovered Ancient Temple and Wells in Sambhal by ASI

Telangana HC provides relief to K.T. Rama Rao; no arrest till December 30 in Formula E race case - The Hindu
summary:
Telangana HC Provides Relief to K.T. Rama Rao; No Arrest Till December 30 in Formula E Race Case

Publication Date: December 20, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Telangana High Court has granted interim relief to former Minister K.T. Rama Rao, prohibiting his arrest until December 30 regarding a corruption case involving the release of funds for the Formula E race during his party's government.

  • The High Court has ordered that the investigation should continue while Mr. Rama Rao cooperates with the authorities.
  • The next hearing for the case is scheduled for December 27.
  • Mr. Rama Rao has expressed his readiness to face the allegations legally and claims there is no corruption involved.
Mr. Rama Rao reiterated that the funds were allocated legally and are intended for development in Hyderabad.

This decision allows K.T. Rama Rao to continue his work without the threat of arrest while the investigation is ongoing.
newTitle: Telangana HC Gives K.T. Rama Rao Temporary Relief in Formula E Case

title: India registers 'strong protest' with Dhaka over remarks by Bangladesh leader - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Protests Against Bangladesh Leader's Controversial Remarks

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) of India has lodged a strong protest with the Bangladeshi government over remarks made by Mahfuj Alam, a key aide of the interim government of Bangladesh. Officials emphasized the need for responsible public comments from leaders.

  • India's MEA expressed concern over controversial statements made by a Bangladeshi government aide.
  • Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal reiterated India's interest in fostering relations with Bangladesh.
  • The Bangladeshi aide's Facebook post, which has since been deleted, claimed India should recognize a recent political upheaval in Bangladesh.
  • Recent violence against minorities in Bangladesh has raised concerns for India.
“We have registered our strong protest on this issue with the Bangladesh side. We would like to remind all concerned to be mindful of their public comments.” - Randhir Jaiswal

This incident highlights the sensitive nature of India-Bangladesh relations and the potential for diplomatic tensions arising from public remarks by officials.
newTitle: India Protests Against Bangladesh Leader's Controversial Remarks

The Kia Syros is set to potentially launch its all-electric version in India by 2026, competing with other EVs like Tata Nexon EV and Mahindra XUV400 EV, and expected to offer a driving range of approximately 400 km.

  • The Syros EV will likely be based on the reinforced K1 platform.
  • Design updates may include EV-specific features like revised bumpers.

“Although Kia is yet to reveal the battery pack and electric motor specifications for the Syros EV, we expect it to offer a claimed driving range of around 400 km.”

Subjective walking speed is a quick, equipment-free tool for identifying metabolic health risks - News-Medical.Net
summary:
Subjective Walking Speed is a Quick, Equipment-Free Tool for Identifying Metabolic Health Risks

Publication Date: 2024
Source: Scientific Reports

A recent study explores the relationship between self-reported walking speed and metabolic health risks in obese individuals, suggesting that evaluating perceived walking pace can be beneficial in public health.

  • The research includes over 24,000 adults from health checkups in Japan.
  • Participants with a BMI over 25 and waist circumference above defined thresholds were classified as obese.
  • 45% of participants classified as obese reported faster walking speeds.
  • Fast walking speed is associated with reduced risks of diabetes, hypertension, and dyslipidemia among obese individuals.
  • Fast walking speed can lower the risk of these conditions by significant percentages, particularly highlighting benefits for metabolic health.
"Fast walking speed can reduce the risks of diabetes and dyslipidemia by 30% and 3%, respectively."

The findings underscore walking speed's role as a crucial factor in managing and preventing metabolic diseases in individuals suffering from obesity. Future research should focus on similar longitudinal studies to further validate these results.
newTitle: Subjective Walking Speed as a Tool for Identifying Metabolic Health Risks

Pushpa 2 is on a record-breaking spree. It is enjoying a remarkable run at the box office and is unstoppable, especially in the Hindi belt. Allu Arjun starrer is now all set to enter the top 5 Hindi grossers at the worldwide box office.

This film is setting new records and is on track for remarkable future earnings.

title: Moderate drinkers may live longer than teetotalers, claims a study - The Times of India
summary:
Moderate drinkers may live longer than teetotalers, claims a study

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

This article discusses a study that suggests moderate drinkers may have a longer lifespan compared to those who abstain from alcohol entirely.

  • The study analyzes various health outcomes related to alcohol consumption.
  • Moderate drinking is defined as one to two drinks per day.
  • Researchers found significant differences in longevity between moderate drinkers and teetotalers.
"The evidence is accumulating that moderate drinking can be beneficial for health, particularly in terms of longevity."

In conclusion, the study presents compelling evidence that moderate alcohol consumption may have advantages for longevity, though further research is needed to explore the underlying factors.

Descendants of Aurangzeb riding rickshaws in Kolkata: UP CM Yogi Adityanath continues tirade against 'temple destroyers' - Deccan Herald
summary:
Yogi Adityanath's Remarks on Aurangzeb's Descendants in Kolkata

Published: 20 December 2024, 10:56 IST

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has made controversial remarks regarding the descendants of those who destroyed Hindu temples, claiming they now struggle in Kolkata.

  • Adityanath stated that the clan responsible for temple destruction, including by Mughal rulers like Aurangzeb, would become 'extinct'.
  • He mentioned that those connected to temple desecration currently ply rickshaws near Kolkata.
  • His comments come amid rising tensions following significant communal violence in Sambhal.
  • He emphasized the need to protect Sanatan Dharma to safeguard humanity.
“Their clan will be extinct… only Sanatan Dharma can establish peace in the world.”

Adityanath's comments reflect ongoing communal tensions and evoke historical grievances regarding Hindu temples destroyed during Mughal rule.
newTitle: Yogi Adityanath's Remarks on Aurangzeb's Descendants in Kolkata

title: R Ashwin Shows Off Post-Retirement Call Log, Features Sachin Tendulkar And Kapil Dev - NDTV Sports
summary:
R Ashwin Shows Off Post-Retirement Call Log, Features Sachin Tendulkar And Kapil Dev

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket, leaving behind an impactful legacy with 765 international wickets. He shared a heartwarming moment revealing messages from cricket icons Sachin Tendulkar and Kapil Dev after his retirement.

  • Ashwin retired with 765 international wickets and 537 Test wickets.
  • Tributes have poured in from across the cricket community.
  • He received messages from legends Sachin Tendulkar and Kapil Dev.
  • Ashwin expressed gratitude for the respect and acknowledgment from his peers.
If someone told me 25 years ago that I would have a smartphone with me and the call log on the last day of my career as an Indian cricketer would look like this, I would have had a heart attack then only. Thanks Sachin and Kapil paaji.

Tendulkar congratulated Ashwin, praising his journey and contributions to cricket.

Ashwin's retirement marks the end of an era, leaving behind a legacy of innovation and success in cricket.
newTitle: R Ashwin Shows Off Post-Retirement Call Log, Features Sachin Tendulkar And Kapil Dev
